Find the odd man out: i. Camphor, Ammonium Chloride, Naphthalene balls, Sugar.
References: Reason: Camphor, Ammonium Chloride, and Naphthalene balls are all substances that sublime, while Sugar does not.

questions.Question: Find the odd man out: ii. Turmeric, Methyl Orange, Rose petals, Beetroot.
References: Reason: Turmeric, Rose petals, and Beetroot are natural indicators, while Methyl Orange is a synthetic indicator.

questions.Question: Match the following: Column I i. Myopia ii. Hypermetropia Column Column II (A) Converging power of eye lens becomes low. (B) Converging power of eye lens remains the same (C) Converging power of eye lens becomes high.
References: Answer: i. Myopia - (C) Converging power of eye lens becomes high. ii. Hypermetropia - (A) Converging power of eye lens becomes low.

questions.Question: Fill in the blank: To increase the effective resistance in a circuit the resistors are connected in _______.
References: Reason: Connecting resistors in series increases the total (effective) resistance of the circuit.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: i. CaCO3 = CaO + CO2 is a _______ reaction. (A) combination (B) displacement (C) double displacement (D) decomposition
References: Reason: CaCO3 decomposes into CaO and CO2, which is a decomposition reaction.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: ii. The colour of universal indicator solution is _______. (A) red (B) blue (C) green (D) greenish yellow
References: Reason: Universal indicator solution is green in neutral solutions.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: iii. The height of the image formed by an object of height 10 cm placed in front of a plane mirror is _______. (A) 5 cm (B) 10 cm (C) 15 cm (D) 20 cm
References: Reason: The image formed by a plane mirror is of the same size as the object.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: iv. When the resistance of a conductor increases, the current will _______ (A) increase (B) decrease (C) remain the same (D) become double
References: Reason: According to Ohm's law, if the resistance increases and the voltage remains the same, the current will decrease.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: v. Lime water turns milky when _______ gas is passed through it. (A) H2 (B) CO (C) CO2 (D) SO2
References: Reason: Lime water (calcium hydroxide) reacts with carbon dioxide to form calcium carbonate, which is insoluble and turns the solution milky.

questions.Question: State any three demerits of Mendeleev’s periodic table.

questions.Question: Draw the electrical symbols of the following components and state its use: a. Wire crossing b. Rheostat (variable resistance) c. Ammeter.

Observe the following figure and answer the questions given under it: a. How many times does refraction take place in the above figure? b. What happens to the ray of light when it passes from air to glass? c. What happens to the ray of light when it passes from glass to air? d. What are the rays AB and CD in the figure called? e. Define refraction.
a. Find the expression for resistivity of a material and state the SI unit of resistivity. b. If the current in the coil A is changed, will some current be induced in the coil B? Explain.
The modern periodic table consists of _______ periods.
References: The modern periodic table consists of 7 periods. Periods are the horizontal rows in the periodic table that represent the number of electron shells an atom of an element has.

questions.Question: The formulae of chloride of metal M is MCl2. The metal M belongs to _______ group.
References: The formula MCl2 indicates that the metal M belongs to Group 2 of the periodic table, also known as the alkaline earth metals group. Elements in Group 2 have a valency of +2 and typically form divalent cations.

questions.Question: Corrosion can be prevented by using _______ solution.
References: Corrosion can be prevented by using grease solution. Grease acts as a protective layer that prevents moisture and air from coming into contact with the metal surface, thus inhibiting the corrosion process.

questions.Question: Find odd man out: Voltmeter, ammeter, galvanometer, thermometer.
References: The odd man out is thermometer. Voltmeter, ammeter, and galvanometer are devices used to measure electrical quantities (voltage, current, and resistance), while a thermometer is used to measure temperature.

questions.Question: Find odd man out: Loudspeaker, bar magnet, electric motor, microphone.
References: The odd man out is bar magnet. Loudspeaker, electric motor, and microphone are devices that involve the conversion of electrical energy into mechanical energy (sound) or vice versa, whereas a bar magnet is a source of magnetic field and not an electromechanical device.

questions.Question: Reaction of iron nails with copper sulphate solution is an example of: (A) Combination reaction, (B) Decomposition reaction, (C) Displacement reaction, (D) Double displacement reaction.
References: Reaction of iron nails with copper sulphate solution is an example of (C) Displacement reaction. In this reaction, iron displaces copper from copper sulphate solution to form iron sulphate and copper metal.

questions.Question: Dilute NaOH can be tested with: (A) red litmus paper, (B) blue litmus paper, (C) lime water, (D) Na2CO3.
References: Dilute NaOH can be tested with (A) red litmus paper. NaOH is a strong base, and it turns red litmus paper blue.

questions.Question: In series combination which remains constant? (A) Voltage, (B) Current, (C) Both current and voltage, (D) Both are variables.
References: In series combination, (B) Current remains constant. In a series circuit, the same current flows through each component as there is only one path for the current to follow.

questions.Question: An object of 10 cm is placed in front of a plane mirror. The height of image will be: (A) 5 cm, (B) 15 cm, (C) 20 cm, (D) 10 cm.
References: The height of the image will be (D) 10 cm. In a plane mirror, the image formed is virtual, erect, and of the same size as the object. Therefore, the height of the image will be equal to the height of the object.

questions.Question: When a ray of light travels from air to glass slab and strikes the surface of separation at 90°, then it: (A) bends towards normal, (B) bends away from normal, (C) passes unbent, (D) passes in zigzag way.
References: When a ray of light travels from air to glass slab and strikes the surface of separation at 90°, then it: (C) passes unbent. This is because light undergoes refraction only when it passes from one medium to another at an angle.

questions.Question: Define the following: a. 1 volt PD, b. Electric power.

questions.Question: Explain ‘Electric motor’ with the help of the following points: a. Draw figure b. Principle of Electric motor c. Name any four appliances where electric motor is used.
References: 3. Refer The Chapter Effect of electric Current

questions.Question: The device used for producing electric current is called a _______.
References: The device used for producing electric current is called a generator. A generator converts mechanical energy into electrical energy through electromagnetic induction.

questions.Question: _______, the second layer of the atmosphere reaches 48 km above the earth's surface.
References: Stratosphere, the second layer of the atmosphere, reaches 48 km above the earth's surface. It contains the ozone layer which absorbs most of the Sun's ultraviolet radiation.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following table so as to match the second column with the first column: Column A i.eosin ii. oxidation- 1.losing hydrogen 2.synthetic indicator 3.losing oxygen 4. natural indicator.
Give the molecular formula of bleaching powder.
References: The molecular formula of bleaching powder is CaOCl2. It is used as a disinfectant, bleaching agent, and for water treatment.

questions.Question: When phenolphthalein is added to NaOH, the colour of the solution will become: (A) colourless (B) red (C) pink (D) yellow.
References: When phenolphthalein is added to NaOH, the colour of the solution will become: (C) pink. Phenolphthalein is a pH indicator that turns pink in basic solutions.

questions.Question: If the potential difference across the ends of a conductor is 220 V and the resistance of the conductor is 44  (ohm), then the current flowing through is: (A) 0.2 A (B) 0.5 A (C) 2 A (D) 5 A.
References: 1. If the potential difference across the ends of a conductor is 220 V and the resistance of the conductor is 44 (ohm), then the current flowing through is: (C) 2 A. According to Ohm's law, I=V/R, where V is the potential difference and R is the resistance.

questions.Question: 1 A = _______ mA (A) 10^2 (B) 10^3 (C) 10^-3 (D) 10^-6.
References: 1. 1 A = 10^3 mA (B) 10^3. The prefix 'milli' denotes 10^{-3}, so 1 Ampere (A) equals 1000 milliamps (mA).

questions.Question: The distance between principal focus and optical centre of the lens is: (A) diameter (B) focal length (C) principal axis (D) optical centre.
References: The distance between principal focus and optical centre of the lens is: (B) focal length. Focal length is the distance between the principal focus and the optical centre of a lens.

questions.Question: When rays of light are incident on a glass slab, then the incident ray and emergent ray are _______ to each other. (A) perpendicular (B) parallel (C) opposite (D) concurrent.
References: When rays of light are incident on a glass slab, then the incident ray and emergent ray are (A) perpendicular to each other. The angle between the incident ray and the emergent ray is 90 degrees.

Answer the following questions: a. What does the negative power indicate? b. What does the positive power indicate? c. Generally which type of spectacles do most of the students use? d. What defect of eyesight do most of the students suffer from? e. Give two possible reasons for the above defect
Rewrite the following statements with suitable words in the blanks: i. Very fine particles mainly scatter _______ coloured light.
References: Very fine particles mainly scatter blue coloured light. This is due to Rayleigh scattering, where shorter wavelengths of light (blue) are scattered more than longer wavelengths (red).

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements with suitable words in the blanks: ii. The element eka-silicon in Mendeleev’s periodic table is known as _______ in the modern periodic table.
References: The element eka-silicon in Mendeleev’s periodic table is known as germanium in the modern periodic table. Mendeleev predicted its existence and properties before it was discovered.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements with suitable words in the blanks: iii. Sodium or Potassium salt of higher fatty acid is termed as _______.
References: Sodium or Potassium salt of higher fatty acid is termed as soap. Soaps are produced through the saponification process, which involves the reaction of a fat or oil with a base.

questions.Question: State whether the following statements are True or False: i. CuSO4(aq) + Zn(s) = ZnSO4(aq) + Cu(s) is an example of decomposition reaction.
References: False. CuSO4(aq) + Zn(s) = ZnSO4(aq) + Cu(s) is an example of a displacement reaction, where zinc displaces copper from copper sulfate solution.

questions.Question: State whether the following statements are True or False: ii. Magnetic lines of force are closed continuous curves.
References: True. Magnetic lines of force are closed continuous curves. They emerge from the north pole of a magnet and enter the south pole, continuing through the magnet to form closed loops.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: i. The reddish brown deposit formed on iron nails kept in a solution of copper sulphate is: (A) Cu2O (B) Cu (C) CuO (D) CuS
References: The reddish brown deposit formed on iron nails kept in a solution of copper sulphate is: (B) Cu. This is because copper metal is deposited on the iron nails due to a displacement reaction.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: ii. What will be the change in the current, if the potential difference is kept constant and the resistance of the circuit is made four times? (A) It will remain unchanged (B) It will become four times (C) It will become one-fourth (D) It will become half
References: If the potential difference is kept constant and the resistance of the circuit is made four times, the current will: (C) It will become one-fourth. According to Ohm’s Law, I=V/R, so increasing resistance decreases current.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: iii. A ray of light strikes the glass slab at an angle of 50°. What is the angle of incidence? (A) 50° (B) 25° (C) 40° (D) 100°
References: A ray of light strikes the glass slab at an angle of 50°. The angle of incidence is: (A) 50°. The angle of incidence is the angle between the incident ray and the normal to the surface at the point of incidence.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: iv. From which plant is litmus paper or litmus solution obtained? (A) Moss (B) Rose (C) Hibiscus (D) Lichen
References: Litmus paper or litmus solution is obtained from: (D) Lichen. Lichens are used to extract the natural dye used in litmus paper.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following statements by selecting the correct options: v. If the equivalent resistance is to be increased, then the number of resistance should be connected in: (A) series (B) parallel (C) mixed arrangement (D) none of the above
References: If the equivalent resistance is to be increased, then the number of resistances should be connected in: (A) series. In a series arrangement, resistances add up, increasing the total resistance.

questions.Question: Elements in the same group show same valency. Give scientific reason.
References: 3. Refer The Chapter Periodic Classification of Elements

questions.Question: Find the resistance of a conductor if 0.24 A current is passing through it and potential difference of 24 V is applied across it.
References: 3. Refer The Chapter Effect of electric Current

questions.Question: Differentiate between Primary pollutants and Secondary pollutants.

References: 3. Refer The Chapter Periodic Classification of Elements

References: 3. Refer The Chapter Refraction of Light

questions.Question: State three differences between Direct current and Alternating current.
References: 3. Refer The Chapter Effect of electric Current

questions.Question: After you have dinner tonight, wash your own plate with soap/detergent. 1. What colour change is observed when soap/detergent is applied? 2. Name the type of reaction and explain it.
References: 3. Refer The Chapter Chemical Reactions and Equations

questions.Question: Methyl orange is used as an indicator. It shows colour changes in acid, base and neutral substance. Tabulate your results.
References: 3. Refer The Chapter Chemical Reactions and Equations

questions.Question: Given below is a diagram showing a defect of human eye. a. Name the defect shown in the figure. b. Give two possible reasons for this defect of eye in human being. c. Name the type of lens used to correct the eye defect.
Define refraction and state the laws of refraction.

References: 3. Refer The Chapter Effect of electric Current

questions.Question: With the help of appropriate ray diagram, state the sign convention for reflection by spherical mirror.
Fill in the blanks: The chemical formula of rust is ________
References: The chemical formula of rust is Fe2O3·nH2O. Rust is a result of the oxidation of iron in the presence of water and oxygen, forming hydrated iron(III) oxide.

questions.Question: Fill in the blanks: The law used by Newlands to arrange elements is known as _________
References: The law used by Newlands to arrange elements is known as the Law of Octaves. Newlands observed that every eighth element had similar properties when the elements were arranged in order of increasing atomic weight.

questions.Question: State whether the following statements are True or False: The pH of rain water is 7.
References: False. The pH of rainwater is typically slightly acidic, around 5.6, due to the presence of dissolved carbon dioxide forming carbonic acid. Pure water has a pH of 7.

questions.Question: State whether the following statements are True or False: The SI unit of charge is volt.
References: False. The SI unit of charge is the coulomb (C). The volt (V) is the SI unit of electric potential or electromotive force.

questions.Question: Rewrite the following table to match the second and third columns with the first column: Column I: Dispersion, Refraction, Hypermetropia; Column II: Long-sightedness, Splitting of white light into component colours, Change in the direction of ray of light due to change in medium; Column III: Twinkling of stars, Convex lens, Spectrum of seven colours
References: Dispersion: Splitting of white light into component colours, Spectrum of seven colours. Refraction: Change in the direction of ray of light due to change in medium, Twinkling of stars. Hypermetropia: Long-sightedness, Convex lens.

questions.Question: Why should the wires carrying electricity not be touched bare-footed?
References: 3. Refer The Chapter Effect of electric Current
